intro: Antherothamnus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid thamnus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its erect, rigid stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Antherothamnus rigidus is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
